GPIO Driver

Typedefs

typedef uint32_t GPIO_PinConfig
 GPIO pin configuration settings. More...
 
typedef void(* GPIO_CallbackFxn) (uint32_t index)
 GPIO callback function type. More...
 

GPIO_PinConfig pin Input/Output configuration macros

These macros define the Input/Output properties associated with the GPIO pin.

#define GPIO_CFG_OUTPUT   (((uint32_t)1U) << GPIO_CFG_IO_LSB)
 Pin is an output.
 
#define GPIO_CFG_OUT_OD_NOPULL   (((uint32_t)2U) << GPIO_CFG_IO_LSB)
 Output pin is Open Drain.
 
#define GPIO_CFG_INPUT   (((uint32_t)16U) << GPIO_CFG_IO_LSB)
 Pin is an input.
 

GPIO_PinConfig Interrupt configuration macros

These macros define the Interrupt properties associated with the GPIO pin.

#define GPIO_CFG_IN_INT_NONE   (((uint32_t)1) << GPIO_CFG_INT_LSB)
 No Interrupt.
 
#define GPIO_CFG_IN_INT_FALLING   (((uint32_t)2) << GPIO_CFG_INT_LSB)
 Interrupt on falling edge.
 
#define GPIO_CFG_IN_INT_RISING   (((uint32_t)4) << GPIO_CFG_INT_LSB)
 Interrupt on rising edge.
 
#define GPIO_CFG_IN_INT_BOTH_EDGES   (((uint32_t)8) << GPIO_CFG_INT_LSB)
 Interrupt on both edges.
 
#define GPIO_CFG_IN_INT_LOW   (((uint32_t)16)<< GPIO_CFG_INT_LSB)
 Low priority interrupt: Set to 1 for Low Priority Pin interrupt else the Pin is automatically configured as a High Priority interrupt.
 

Detailed Description

The section has a list of all external data structures which are exposed to the application.

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* GPIO_CallbackFxn) (uint32_t index)

GPIO callback function type.

Parameters
indexGPIO index. This is the same index that was passed to GPIO_setCallback(). This allows you to use the same callback function for multiple GPIO interrupts, by using the index to identify the GPIO that caused the interrupt.
typedef uint32_t GPIO_PinConfig

GPIO pin configuration settings.

The upper 16 bits of the 32 bit PinConfig is reserved for pin configuration settings.

The lower 16 bits are reserved for device-specific port/pin identifications

The figures below represent the distribution of the higher order 32 bits.

 Input/Output Field: [Refer to the Input/Output configuration macros]
------------------------------------------
| 23 | 22 | 21 | 20 | 19 | 18 | 17 | 16 |
------------------------------------------

Interrupt Fields: [Refer to the Interrupt configuration macros]
--------------------------------
| 29 | 28 | 27 | 26 | 25 | 24 |
--------------------------------

Internally used [Reserved fields]
-------------
 | 31 | 30 |
-------------
